body.name: Computer Speaker USB Powered - 2.0 Mini Portable Bluetooth Subwoofer with RGB Lights Volume Control 3.5mm AUX-in HiFi Stereo Sound Desk Audio System for PCs Laptops Tablet Phone
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Monday, February 19 on orders shipped by Amazon over $35
Or fastest delivery Friday, February 16. Order within 21 mins
features: 【Stereo Sound Quality】Bobtot Computer speaker with 3W*2 large dual drive unit, up to 6W output, you could enjoy the sound-surround ambiance easily. The great sound quality of the speaker is perfect for music, movie, and game.

【Plug and Play】The USB cable for power and the aux-in cable for the sound. The Bobtot mini computer speakers work with any device that has a standard 3.5mm headphone jack, such as laptop, desktop, cellphone, tablet, projector, USB Charger, power bank and etc.

【RGB LED Lights】Our speakers with colorful RGB lights that create the dynamics mode. The controller can control the LED light color and mode. There are three colors (Red, Green, Blue) and four modes (flash, slow flash, one color and turn off).

【Small and Compact】Portable Wired Speaker with dimensions 2.6in(L)x2.4in(W)x3.35in(H), cable Length 5.74ft/1.75m, cable Length from Left Channel to Right Channel: 5ft/1.5m. The compact size is easy for mobile listening.

productInformation.name: Customer Reviews
productInformation.value: 3.7 3.7 out of 5 stars 31 ratings 3.7 out of 5 stars

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Previous page Next page 1 RGB LED Light 2 Bluetooth Mode 3 Plug and Play

Easy to Use 3.5mm audio input, USB power supply, can be directly plugged into the power supply of a 5V charger. Just plug and play. Easy to use the controller to switch the mode between Bluetooth and wired, adjust the volume, control the RGB lights. Stereo Sound Quality 3W*2 large dual drive unit, up to 6W output, perfect for listening to music, playing games, and watching videos. The speakers provide powerful stereo sound.

Can the RGB lights be turned off? Yes, the lights can be turned off. Short press the led button can change the light mode. What should I do when I plugged it into my computer it only show the lights and not play any audio? Please check if the 3.5mm AUX cable is pluged correctly to headphone jack and make sure that "Headset Realtek Audio" is selected as your computer playback device. How long of the cable between two speakers? The length of the cable between two speakers is 5FT(1.5M). The whole cable length is 5.74FT(1.75M). How to change the Mode between Bluetooth and Wired? Long press the M/Play button for 2 seconds to switch modes from Aux to Bluetooth. Use your device to search BT name "MINI2" to connect it. If you need to disconnect it, just double-press the M/Play button.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 1, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars For the price they are. It's a wonderful crisp, clear sound.
reviews.reviewText: The media could not be loaded. I love these speakers if you are a person that has a budget and want some decent speakers. These are the speakers to get. Even if you do have the money and you want something decent. I would grab these guys.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 19, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Seamless install and initialization.
reviews.reviewText: I am sitting at a desk working on my primary computer. I have a set of Harmon Kardon speakers attached to it. There is a large sub woofer and the sound that those can put out is really strong. The desktops to my left and right both have Altec Lansing speakers attached and, again, one has a fairly large sub woofer and the other one has a much larger sub woofer attached. The sound output on each set is really good. I have another desktop sitting on a desk downstairs. I had an older Altec Lansing set of speakers attached to that one. Those had developed an irritating sound that would come and go and sometimes just stay on in the background. I finally just turned them off. We do not use that computer that much, but I wanted a bit more sound than a monitor can provide. So, I ordered this set.The installation is easy. Plug them into a USB port and they immediately turn on. Plug the sound jack into the proper port and you immediately have sound. Instructions are basically written in mice type, but are fairly simple since they work seamlessly. I do NOT like the short press this button and long press that button stuff but, fortunately there is not a lot of additional stuff to worry about. The little speakers have color changing lights on the front which might seem cool to some but I found them to be annoying. So I short pressed the LED button a few times to cycle them through the various colors and turn them off. I said what I said above about my other speakers to say this. This little set will not give you sound that is comparable to what you can expect with a set that has a sizable sub woofer and a couple of tweeters. In fact, the bass output is a bit on the weak side. But, they are still decent speakers and will work well in a setup where you just want decent sound. The set is fairly small, so if you want to transport them with a laptop, that will not be difficult to do.You can also set them up via bluetooth if you so desire, but I did not try that setting.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 24, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Greta for desktop
reviews.reviewText: This is a solid little set of speakers! They are definitely loud enough to use at a desk but would definitely struggle if you moved to the couch, depending on the ambient noise level. For the price, they’re great. The only flaw I’ve noticed in my month of ownership is that the RGB light do not shut off. There is a button labeled rgb on the inline controller but pressing it does nothing. If it weren’t for this flaw, they would be 5 stars because of the value they offer!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 20, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Amazing Sound for Little Speakers
reviews.reviewText: These little speakers put out a great sound for their size. Much better than I expected as I am using them as a standard PC speaker. When I play music through them, it is very surprising as to the quality and depth. I am not saying that these are producing sound for the ages but I am saying that for the price and size, they are a great deal.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 30, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Not much volume, colors are fun
reviews.reviewText: I was just about ready to write a really bad review: I battled for an hour or two trying to get the speakers to emit any sound except "connected" "disconnected" and "dududu". While these sounds were good news because they indicated that the bluetooth connection worked, I just could not get any audio from my Mac Mini M1. Then I turned up the volume all the way to the max on the speaker control, in the system settings of my Mac, and in the application that I was using to play music. Voila! That worked.So, warning number one is that these speakers are not loud. Normal volume settings for my regular desktop external speakers was not sufficient to produce even the slightest sound. Everything set to the max was a little loud for me but probably not for a teenager.Warning number two is that the sound, once produced, is rather tinny. If you want concert hall sound on classical music, you'll need better speakers than these.Other than the foregoing, everything was OK. The colors were fun to play around with but an old toot like me doesn't really care all that much. I eventually just turned them off entirely (which, thankfully, is easy to do). The bluetooth connection was good and I did not detect any lag in the audio for several videos I played. I was able to pair the speakers with my iPhone. The volume seemed to be a bit louder when connected to the iPhone than when connected to my Mac.The issue with speaker volume might be partially a Mac issue. The Mac mini does not have a jack for external speakers -- its jack is intended to be a headphone jack. As such the Mac may well be trimming the volume levels down to avoid overloading the headphones (and eardrums).

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 13, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Lights up and blinks but no sound whatsoever. Tried in two different inputs and nothing. Plugged an older speaker into the same input and it worked fine. Tried everything to get it to work. Nothing, now its landfill. Don't waste your money on this, look for something with some quality.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 1, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 2.0 out of 5 stars Not worth the original price of 26$
reviews.reviewText: For 26 bucks I sure did not expect high-quality sound, but still more than they deliver.I have a permanent background noise as soon as I rise the volume wheel of the speaker. So, I have it maybe up at 20%. When I use just the Win11 volume adjustment, it does not seem to get as much background noise, but I am limited with the max volume. Although, questioning myself if I would even ever blast them.The sound is in general rather dull and boring. Quickly can sound like you watch somebody on youtube whose TV is running in the background.The LEDs are what I have expected, nothing bad to say about them.Cable length is good.They are okay enough if you get them for around 10-15bucks, but else, quality and price just don't match up.
